The Bacillus subtilis PROTEIN2 operon is regulated by two stress induction pathways relying on either PROTEIN1 or a class III stress induction mechanism acting at a sigmaA-like promoter.
The Bacillus subtilis PROTEIN2 operon is regulated by two stress induction pathways relying on either sigmaB or a class III stress induction mechanism acting at a PROTEIN1-like promoter.
The Bacillus subtilis clpC operon is regulated by two stress induction pathways relying on either PROTEIN1 or a class III stress induction mechanism acting at a PROTEIN2-like promoter.

Our data demonstrate that the PROTEIN1 protein acts as a global repressor of the PROTEIN2 operon, as well as other class III heat shock genes, by preventing unstressed transcription from either the sigmaB- or sigmaA-dependent promoter and might be inactivated or dissociate under inducing stress conditions.
